project.teaser: The project is directed at addressing challenges for developing next-generation high-entropy-alloy-based multi-component green (free of toxic substances) and sustainable (rare earth free & minimum critical metal elements) coatings with predictable functionalities, performance...
project.objective: The project is directed at addressing challenges for developing next-generation high-entropy-alloy-based multi-component green (free of toxic substances) and sustainable (rare earth free & minimum critical metal elements) coatings with predictable functionalities, performance and life - aiming at increasing wear resistance by 100%, corrosion/oxidation reThe project is directed at addressing challenges for developing next generation high entropy alloy-based multi-component green (free of toxic substances) and sustainable (rare earth free & minimum critical metal elements) coatings with predictable functionalities, performance and life (hardness & wear resistance increased by 50-100%, corrosion resistance increased by 20-40%, and thermal stability & oxidation resistance increased by 30-60%) and effectively reduced use of CRMs by 30-40% by integrating AI/ML underpinned Computational Modelling with Safe and Sustainability by Design framework facilitated by high-throughput characterisation & evaluation. These developments together will lead to a much efficient approach and tool to support the co-design of coating materials and substrate systems, optimisation of PVD processes, and reduced overall new coating system development cycle time by 50-100%, and material savings and waste reductions for developing the new coating systems by at least by 4-5 folds, comparing to traditional experimental trials and error approaches. The advancement of M2DESCO will contribute to combating the loss in EU region caused by corrosion and wear, excellently increase the global profile and competitive edge of EU modelling community and significantly strengthen the competitiveness of EU coating research and business with an European market size of €196 mill in 2020 and €421M in 2026 for anti-corrosion coatings and anti-wear hard coatings respectively thus greatly benefiting the wider manufacturing chain and effectively increasing the global competitiveness and the resilience of EU industry.
project.title: Computational Multi-Models Enabled Design of Safe & Sustainable Multi-Component High-Entropy Coatings
project.keywords: Multiscale modelling, DFT, MD, Montecarlo, coating substances, vapor deposition, entropy alloys

article.title: Computational modelling for sustainable high-entropy coatings

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - M2DESCO (Computational Multi-Models Enabled Design of Safe & Sustainable Multi-Component High-Entropy Coatings)
result.teaser: The project is directed at addressing challenges for developing next-generation high-entropy-alloybased multi-component green (free of toxic substances) and sustainable (rare earth free & minimum critical metal elements) coatings with predictable functionalities, performance...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Quality and Risk Management plan (1/3)
result.description: Quality and Risk Management plan. Revision of Risk Assessment. Interim report M3. Reevaluation of critical risks and management tools

result.title: AISEC (Integrated Platform) System Design
result.description: Definition of requirements and design principles for AISEC platform. User inteface, Web intefaces, data processing, etc. Communication protocols. KPIs of Result R3. Task 5.1.

result.title: Plan for dissemination, communication, skill development, collaborations and open sciences (1/3)
result.description: Plan for dissemination and review of dissemination/trainning activities already carried out. Interim revision M18.

result.title: CFD-based full chamber model for simulating the PVD process
result.description: Chamber-scale model based on CFD simulation for the PVD coating, considering physical phenomena. Gas-particle interactions transport, depending on PVD parameterization. KPIs of R1. Task 3.2

result.title: Active screen plasma nitriding of FeCrNiCoMo0.2 high entropy alloy for combating wear

details.authors: Yepeng Yang, Xiaoying Li, Xiao Tao, Biao Cai, Hanshan Dong
details.journalTitle: Journal of Materials Research and Technology

result.title: Physicochemical and Toxicological Properties of Particles Emitted from Scalmalloy During the LPBF Process

details.authors: Nikoletta Sargioti, Leonidas Karavias, Leonidas Gargalis, Anna Karatza, Elias P. Koumoulos, Evangelia K. Karaxi

result.title: Qualified individual Computational Models for HEA designs
result.description: Selected models for HEA coating materials including composition, microstructure and basic propertiese obtained by first principle calculations and mechanical modelling tools. KPIs of Result R1. Task 2.2.

result.title: Information exchanges, data-accessibility & FAIR data principles (1/3)
result.description: Report on rationalization of the information exchange within and outside the Consortium, targeting a standardized (based, e.g., on MODA or CHADA) and FAIR approach. Data collection and harmonization. Data repository structuring and gobernance. Status after completion of Task 1.5.

result.title: Hard TiAlTaN coating by HIPIMS deposition for cutting tools: experiments, simulations and cutting tests

details.authors: Emile Haye, Loris Chavée, Judith Sabata Mas, Essam Serag, Szilard Kolozsvari, Noé Watiez, Aurélien Besnard, Yoann Pinot, Pavel Moskovkin, Jérôme Muller, Stéphane Lucas

result.title: General SSbD coating material and process design methodology (1/3)
result.description: Preliminary Definition of all steps on SSbD methodologies and guiding principles to assess eco-design of coating material and process with the less impact to environment. Related to KPI of Result R2 of the DoA. Task 1.2.

result.title: Collaborations with RESILIENCE sister projects and initiatives (1/3)
result.description: Collaborative Actions carried out with other RESILIENCE projects and communities.

result.title: Data Management Plan (1/3)
result.description: Data Management Plan with respect to indicated in the proposal.

result.title: Open science practices and exchanges with EU, stakeholders and platforms (1/3)
result.description: Upgrade of open science practices carried out.

result.title: High-throughput combinatorial PVD deposition technique & procedure
result.description: Results and outcomes of film HE properties deposited using combinatorial (multitarget) codepositions. Compositions, crystallographic structures, and basic properties (nano-hardness). KPIs of R5. Task 3.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
